Take heart ! you'll succeed soon! Last month my friend Paul married Amy, his girlfriend from Tinder. They were married by a pastor at Rosewood Hotel. I said "Wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness!" My brother said "Best wishes on this wonderful journey as you build your new lives together!" My elder sister write "Thank you for letting us share in this joyful day! We wish you all the best as you embark on this wonderful union!" My younger sister said "Congratulations on finding each other! Your greatest adventure has just begun!" My cousin said "Wishing you fulfillment of every dream!" Paul honours his parents. He's thankful for what his parents have done for him. His brother is also a good son while his sister needs to be a better daughter. In the east teachers and parents stress the importance of filial piety which means Chinese parental respect. They teach that you should honour your parents and take care of them. Recently Paul's cousin has stolen his Gucci watchstrap. I felt honour bound to tell him. His dad is a man of honour and high integrity. Both of us are kickboxing fans. In February Fred will be fighting Chris for the honour of his country. Winning the championship is a matter of personal honour, family honour and national honour. Last week his church held a feast in honour of Fred. Paul asked if I could do him the honour of accompanying him to the feast which I did. It was a signal honour to meet Fred. Fred.said humbly "it's a great honour to have you here Paul" We asked him whether he could do us the honour of becoming our sambo coach. He said "I'll see." The waiters did the honours and greeted the guests at the door. After we sat down Fred asked the waitress "will you do the honours and cut us a piece of chicken ?" Fred said to us "I eiukd be honoured if you would come and see my fight in february" We gave him.an affirmative response. Last year the chairman of the organisation told Fred "I would be honoured if you attended the hall of fame ceremony" which he did. He was honoured for his performance in his last fight. Besides winning the championship he was honoured with an award for excellence in grappling. Many fans bought front row tickets for the next kickboxing event at half price or less due to a computer problem but the organisation stated that they would honour these tickets nonetheless which could cost over five hundred thousand dollars in lost earnings. Fred's great grandad was commissioned as a sergeant major in the first world war. He was buried with full military honours.
